interface.name: Skeleton
interface.javadoc:
The Skeleton interface is used solely by the RMI implementation.

Every version 1.1 (and version 1.1 compatible skeletons generated in 1.2 using rmic -vcompat) skeleton class generated by the rmic stub compiler implements this interface. A skeleton for a remote object is a server-side entity that dispatches calls to the actual remote object implementation. Ann Wollrath JDK1.1 no replacement. Skeletons are no longer required for remote method calls in the Java 2 platform v1.2 and greater.

Unmarshals arguments, calls the actual remote object implementation, and marshals the return value or any exception.
obj remote implementation to dispatch call to
theCall object representing remote call
opnum operation number
hash stub/skeleton interface hash
java.lang.Exception if a general exception occurs.
JDK1.1
no replacement

Returns the operations supported by the skeleton.
operations supported by skeleton
